messages: 28b758a09ea8d35984b5319eb643b6c5 (11:15): Hi! I'm trying to align some elements in my page - but unless I set them as position:absolute, they won't budge!
28b758a09ea8d35984b5319eb643b6c5 (11:29): Keloran, how do I set as float? (I've forgotten)
c70fc3eda76c3c8cf490069c364e7eeb (11:29): take out the line with position in
c70fc3eda76c3c8cf490069c364e7eeb (11:30): depends on how your page is layed out though before you can use float really
c70fc3eda76c3c8cf490069c364e7eeb (11:31): also if you have to use position: absolute/relative, you should be still able to use, top:/bottom:, left:/right:
01e74ed72529335988b33abf8198493f (11:31): Hi! How can I make the background image static in IE?
01e74ed72529335988b33abf8198493f (11:33): yeah.. so that when the text overflows, the image doesn't scroll with it..
01e74ed72529335988b33abf8198493f (11:34): Keloran: no, that is for avoiding repetition
c70fc3eda76c3c8cf490069c364e7eeb (11:35): i tend not to use images

01e74ed72529335988b33abf8198493f (11:37): "Even if the image is fixed, it is still only visible when it is in the background or padding area of the element. Thus, unless the image is tiled ('background-repeat: repeat'), it may be invisible."
01e74ed72529335988b33abf8198493f (11:37): I don't want it to repeat
01e74ed72529335988b33abf8198493f (11:37): now the bg image has disappeared in firefox
c70fc3eda76c3c8cf490069c364e7eeb (11:38): i think that means, if theres nothing in the div, then it wont show
c70fc3eda76c3c8cf490069c364e7eeb (11:39): only way to find out is to test it
bae4f3944ed80aac1111427c1efb8f2f (11:41): Hi. I was wondering, if anyone uses image replacement techniques: is it better to use left:-9999em, or something like text-indent:-9999em ?
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (11:41): I like to use text-indent: widthofelement;
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (11:42): usually along with overflow: hidden; and white-space: fun
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (11:44): so it indents as far as the element is wide, therefore not being seen
bae4f3944ed80aac1111427c1efb8f2f (11:46): what if there's a container
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (11:48): awful lot of work for the renderer
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (11:48): it has to keep track of where that text is, you know

bae4f3944ed80aac1111427c1efb8f2f (11:49): say you have a container of 760px width, and you have a background color on the body element. you then have a header which gets the width of the container (760px) and you apply a text-indent on your image replacement h1 of -760px.. dont you see that on top of the.. background?
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (11:50): I would do text-indent: 760px; overflow: hidden; white-space: pre; or nowrap or whatever
bae4f3944ed80aac1111427c1efb8f2f (11:51): what does whitespace: pre; do?
bae4f3944ed80aac1111427c1efb8f2f (11:51): ive never used whitespace before
bae4f3944ed80aac1111427c1efb8f2f (11:53): reisio: using your method vs. left:-9999em or text-indent:-9999em, how much time would you save for the browser in loading? or what benefits do you get ?
bae4f3944ed80aac1111427c1efb8f2f (11:54): but you use it because its your own style? or just..
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (11:54): it just makes more sense to me
bae4f3944ed80aac1111427c1efb8f2f (11:55): but do you support image replacement techniques?
bae4f3944ed80aac1111427c1efb8f2f (11:56): by 'only when needed' i mean like, you have a simple styled <h3> header text and you replace it with the SAME exact header text but as an image
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (11:56): I only use img if it's like a photograph or image meant to be scrutinized
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (11:56): otherwise it's background image with hidden text
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (11:56): scrutinized, contemplated, thought about, observed, seen
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (11:56): if I wanted someone to look at an image of art, I would use img
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (11:57): or if I wanted someone to see what the outside of a building looks like, I'd use a photo as an img
bae4f3944ed80aac1111427c1efb8f2f (11:57): actual photos that represent actual pictures = <img> ?
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (11:57): yeah it shouldn't be an img (imo) unless it's _content_
bae4f3944ed80aac1111427c1efb8f2f (11:57): but thats going too far
c70fc3eda76c3c8cf490069c364e7eeb (11:58): how is less markup, too far ??
bae4f3944ed80aac1111427c1efb8f2f (11:58): i dont want to be the bad guy here
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (12:02): you'd have to have a leg to stand on first :p

7e21c064734a26ab6fb9b2fa5c3a5a3e (12:15): I have two <span> elements side-by-side. I want one to have a width of 30% (of the parent div's width)... but it only seems to work if they're DIVs. DIV won't work because Safari doesn't seem to like the way I've floated (and they shouldn't be block elements anyway...)... so is there any other way?
7e21c064734a26ab6fb9b2fa5c3a5a3e (12:20): ripthejacker: I want total width to be 30%. Can't do that with margins unless I use an expression() which is IE-only.
01e74ed72529335988b33abf8198493f (12:21): Can an element have both a class and an id?
7e21c064734a26ab6fb9b2fa5c3a5a3e (12:22): derek_: Yes, but any property defined in ID will _always_ override class. So if you dynamically change the class of an object, it may not change everything.

7e21c064734a26ab6fb9b2fa5c3a5a3e (12:23): reisio: If I have two divs with float: left; INSIDE an object... and then a third floating not inside anything.. the third will line up with the first for some odd reason... rather than actually being on the left of the bounds of its parent :\

e3f1ebc07b50a897a9048e4891cc186e (12:24): I always have the same problem, maybe you can tell me an easy way to do it: I have a menu using an UL list, i want a separator between each LI element, im using a background image for this aligned to right, everything is ok exept for the first element, i want the first element to have a separator before too, im explaining me well? any suggestions?
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (12:24): oticon6: you only need to float the first one
7e21c064734a26ab6fb9b2fa5c3a5a3e (12:25): reisio: Clear is used. I need to float them all... IE defaults unfloated divs to 100%, and the supposed "natural" margin: 0 auto; thing doesn't seem to work
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (12:26): Agux: apply the background to the ul
e3f1ebc07b50a897a9048e4891cc186e (12:28): reisio: im trying but is not showing, should i use any display property or something in the UL?

7e21c064734a26ab6fb9b2fa5c3a5a3e (12:29): reisio: Never mind, works now. Leaving the second unfloated and using margin: 0 auto; moves the content to the right spot, but any background-color (which was only for testing) still uses the full 100%... odd bug, but irrelevant
7e21c064734a26ab6fb9b2fa5c3a5a3e (12:29): s/uses/uses and therefore covers any other elements in the/ :\
e3f1ebc07b50a897a9048e4891cc186e (12:30): reisio: sorry i dont have the stuff online, nevermind thanks
c95720c193df40ce1618d1b00b040b42 (12:30): Agux, paste: Paste links, not code ( http://erxz.com/pb/ , http://css.commctrl.com , http://sial.org/pbot/ , http://tnx.nl/scribble.plp )
